project.teaser: EU transport and power generation accounts approximately each for one-third of all CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion. While current decarbonisation measures are focused principally on two alternatives: electrification and fuel switching, these are not suitable for the...
project.objective:
EU transport and power generation accounts approximately each for one-third of all CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion. While current decarbonisation measures are focused principally on two alternatives: electrification and fuel switching, these are not suitable for the harder-to-abate sectors, such as heavy-duty road transport or decentralised energy production due to payload, autonomy and/or fuel supply requisites, among other issues. In fact, these sectors still rely on fossil fuels for 94% of its energy needs, constituting one of the main challenges to comply with the objectives of the Paris Agreement.
These sectors require a system that allows to exploit the advantages of the use of liquid fuels, as are high energy density, fast refilling and easy transport, but bypassing the efficiency limitations and eliminating CO2 emissions. In addition, to tackle the alarming increase of GHG emissions and the rise of global temperature, it is necessary to deploy an effective solution in the short-medium term. Therefore, it is key not to depend on the construction of new infrastructures and be able to use the existing ones for the transport, storage and supply of liquid fuels.
The main objective of ALL-IN Zero is to develop a multi-fuel system to generate electrical and mechanical power with zero emissions. This system will feed low, zero or carbon carbon-negative fuels like ammonia, natural gas, biogas or alcohols, into a Compact Membrane Reactor producing a common intermediate temporary energy vector to be consumed in situ by power generation systems such as internal combustion engines and fuel cells.
ALL-IN Zero will accelerate decarbonisation earlier than other technologies, using available productive and supply chains, SoA technologies, and upstream and downstream treatments for mobile and stationary solutions.
project.title: Renewable and flexible fuel power generation technology enabling the multi-sectorial decarbonization with Zero emissions
project.keywords: Multi-fuel, accelerated decarbonisation, zero-emission, efficient energy conversion, mobile and stationary power generation, heavy-duty transport, compact membrane reactor, fuel cell, ICE

article.title: A multi-fuel system for heavy-duty road transport

result.title: Fuel cell system specification datasheet and manual
result.description: Specification manual of the modified research fuel cell system indicating the capabilities of the research fuel cell system, the measurable data and the types of testing activities that can be performed based on the control degree over the balance of plant actuators.

result.title: H2ICE installed and adapted to UPV's test bench
result.description: H2ICE installed in a testbench equipped with a dynamometer, engine instrumentation to measure main operation parameters (speed, torque, fluids mass flow, pressure and temperature at different locations in the gas and liquid circuits -coolant and oil -), NOx emissions and in-cylinder pressure.

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: Project management plan including a detailed Gantt chart with a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), the schedule per task, responsible partner for each subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks.

result.title: Fuel cell integration report
result.description: Full definition of the FC stack and BoP components of the FC system as well as a description of the integration process and the measurable/controllable variables during steady-state and transient testing based on both the capabilities of UPV's testing facility and the sensorized fuel cell system.

result.title: Experimental assessment of a heavy-duty fuel cell system in relevant operating conditions

details.authors: Jose M. Desantes, R. Novella, M. Lopez-Juarez, I. Nidaguila

result.title: H2ICE prototype technical specification data and manual
result.description: Technical specifications of the H2 research engine including the definition of the geometry of different parts (piston, crankshaft, valve train…), H2 injection and combustion systems, intake and exhaust ports, coolant and oil circuits and control system.

result.title: Monitoring and evaluation annual report of communication and dissemination activities (2nd release)
result.description: Report with the review of the communication and dissemination activities performed and the possible next actions to improve the diffusion of the project social awareness.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ALL-IN Zero (Renewable and flexible fuel power generation technology enabling the multi-sectorial decarbonization with Zero emissions)
result.teaser: EU transport and power generation account for approximately one-third of all CO2 emissions from fossil fuel combustion each, whereas the remaining one-third comes mainly from industry and domestic heating. Current decarbonization measures are focused principally on...

webItem.alternativeText: ALL-IN Zero Technology Integration into a HD Vehicle

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Developed H2ICE research engine
result.description: H2ICE research engine to perform the experimental activities in WP6. The prototype design will have if possible, technology to integrate variable valve timing (VVT), compression ratio, spark timing and different injector locations (port and direct injection).

result.title: Critical paramete identification
result.description: List defining the critical parameters to be measured on each experimental activity to be able to capture the main physical phenomena and energy flows that will be necessary for the system virtual integration and simulation.

result.title: Preliminary sizing analysis
result.description: Report defining the preliminary systems sizing for each application based on the required maximum output power, input flows, and the number of cells/surface per cell where applicable.

result.title: Data Management Plan (1st release)
result.description: Data Management Plan including the guidelines and creative common rights for collecting, storing, handling and making accessible the project data.

result.title: Communication materials
result.description: General communication materials for the ALL-IN Zero communication such as the logo, the templates, the website, a leaflet and a poster to present the project will be designed as well as a short “project teaser” video aiming at raising awareness of the project and its expected outcomes.

result.title: Detailed description of experimental activities
result.description: List of requisites for the experimental activities and sensitivity analyses representative of the CMR-FC/H2ICE coupled operation to ensure that the integrated system (CMR together with FC/ICE) complies with the required system characteristics with the minimum energy and fuel utilisation: multi-fuel capability, highly efficient energy utilisation, adequate dynamic response, CO2-free emission through CCS and modularity/scalability

result.title: Monitoring and evaluation annual report of communication and dissemination activities (1st release)
result.description: Report with the review of the communication and dissemination activities performed and the possible next actions to improve the diffusion of the project social awareness.

result.title: Data Management Plan (2nd release with partial open access)
result.description: Data Management Plan revision including the guidelines and creative common rights for collecting, storing, handling and making accessible the project data. This 2nd release will include the partial open access release of the data generated in the project by month 22.

result.title: Project Management Plan 1st revision
result.description: 1st revision of the project management plan detailing the changes in the general organization of the project management, if any. As in the initial project management plan report it will include a detailed Gantt chart with a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), the schedule per task, responsible partner for each subtasks, related deliverables, and dependencies on other tasks. Any change will be explained accordingly.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
